metadata.title: CVE-2021-22945 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
When sending data to an MQTT server, libcurl <= 7.73.0 and 7.78.0 could in some circumstances erroneously keep a pointer to an already freed memory area and both use that again in a subsequent call to send data and also free it *again*.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-22945` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2
libcurl3-nss - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2
libcurl4 - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.note: amurray> MQTT sending support is only present in curl >= 7.70 - see Message-ID: <nycvar.QRO.7.76.2109061032590.1742@fvyyl>

criterions.comment: curl package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2').
